articles.title: Will Warren Buffett Keep Selling Apple?
articles.summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway recently reduced its stake in Apple, leading to speculation about whether further sales will occur. This article explores Buffett's history with Apple, current challenges facing the tech giant such as declining sales in China and competitive pressures, and the potential market reaction to Berkshire's next 13F filing. Analysts offer differing views on Apple's future, particularly with the upcoming integration of AI.

articles.title: Apple v. Rivos: Lessons for Companies Facing Claims of Trade Secret Theft (US)
articles.summary: This article discusses the lessons learned from the Apple v. Rivos case regarding trade secret theft. It highlights that mere possession of trade secrets is insufficient for misappropriation claims against a new employer and emphasizes the importance of explicit policies against bringing confidential information from former employers. The ruling provides key takeaways for companies to guide their trade secret policies and practices to avoid litigation.

articles.title: Meta, Microsoft, X and Match join Epic Games' battle against Apple
articles.summary: Meta Platforms, Microsoft, X, and Match Group have joined Epic Games in accusing Apple of violating a court-ordered injunction regarding payments in its App Store. The companies claim Apple is in "clear violation" by making it difficult for developers to direct consumers to alternative, cheaper payment methods for digital content. Apple, however, maintains it has fully complied with the injunction, arguing it protects consumers and its ecosystem.

articles.title: DOJ faces tough road in Apple antitrust lawsuit
articles.summary: The Department of Justice's antitrust lawsuit against Apple faces significant challenges, despite drawing parallels to the successful Microsoft case two decades ago. Antitrust specialists highlight key differences and legal precedents that could make it difficult for the DOJ to prove Apple's monopolistic conduct and force product redesigns. Apple is expected to argue that its "walled-garden" approach benefits consumers and that the government's market definition is flawed.

articles.title: Apple Highlights Stryker, an NJIT Alum's Medical Tech Group, for VisionPro App
articles.summary: Apple has recognized Stryker Corp., a medical technology company led by NJIT alumnus Robert Cohen, for its innovative MyMako app utilizing the new VisionPro mixed-reality headset. This app allows surgeons to plan and simulate robot-assisted knee replacement operations in 3D, enhancing surgical planning, in-operation information access, and resident training. Cohen envisions future integration of AI to further optimize implant selection and placement based on patient data within this mixed-reality framework.

articles.title: Masimo plans to spin off consumer business
articles.summary: Medical technology company Masimo Corp is evaluating a proposed spinoff of its consumer business, which includes consumer health and audio products. Masimo's shares rose 13% on the news, which follows investor pressure for changes after a poorly received acquisition. The company plans to retain its healthcare and telehealth products, expecting improved profitability, and current CEO Joe Kiani will lead the new spun-off company as chairman.

articles.title: Options Bulls Resume Blitz on Alphabet Stock
articles.summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) stock is seeing renewed bullish options activity, with shares up 6.1% following reports of Apple potentially licensing Google's Gemini AI. Despite a recent uptick in bearish bets, call volume is again dominating today's options trading as GOOGL eyes its Jan. 29 record high.

articles.title: VGT ETF: High Growth, High Concentration (NYSEARCA:VGT)
articles.summary: Vanguard's Information Technology ETF (VGT) has demonstrated strong historical returns, achieving a 48.3% return over the past year and an average annual return of 20% over the last decade. However, the fund is highly concentrated, with Microsoft and Apple accounting for nearly 41% of its investments. VGT offers a low dividend yield of 0.6%, making it less appealing for investors prioritizing income.

articles.title: Meta Bows Down to EU Regulations After Apple And Google, Cut Subscription Prices for Ad-Free Facebook and Instagram
articles.summary: Meta Platforms has significantly reduced the subscription fee for its ad-free Facebook and Instagram services in Europe, lowering the monthly cost to 5.99 euros from 9.99 euros. This move addresses concerns from privacy and antitrust regulators and comes as a response to the EU's Digital Markets Act (DMA). The company aims to find a middle ground amidst EU privacy laws and the DMA's stipulations, following similar concessions by Google and Apple.

articles.title: LaCie Introduces New Rugged Mini SSD with Up to 4TB Capacity
articles.summary: LaCie, a brand of Seagate, has introduced the new Rugged Mini SSD, offering up to 4TB of durable, fast, and compact storage for content creators. This portable drive boasts read speeds of up to 2000MB/s with USB 3.2 gen 2x2 technology and features an IP54-rated, 3-meter drop-protected, and 1-ton car pressure-resistant design using recycled materials. It is compatible with a wide range of devices including Apple products and PCs, and comes with a three-year warranty, data recovery services, and a one-month Adobe Creative Cloud All Apps plan.

articles.title: Wait, Did Europe Really Outperform the U.S. over the Last Three Years?
articles.summary: This article challenges the common perception that European equities perpetually lag behind their U.S. counterparts. It highlights how a selection of 11 European "GRANOLAS" companies have delivered returns surprisingly similar to the U.S. Magnificent 7 over the past three years. Additionally, the WisdomTree Europe Hedged Equity Fund (HEDJ) has demonstrated significant outperformance against the S&P 500 and comparable European ETFs, attributed to its stock selection process, dividend yield weighting, and exporter tilt, all while trading at a valuation discount.

articles.title: Impact Shares YWCA Women’s Empowerment ETF (WOMN) Reaches $50M in Assets Under Management
articles.summary: The Impact Shares YWCA Women’s Empowerment ETF ($WOMN) has surpassed $50 million in Assets Under Management (AUM), demonstrating investor interest in socially conscious funds. This ETF provides broad market exposure to U.S. companies promoting gender equity, with all net advisory profits donated to the YWCA to support its mission. The partnership between Impact Shares, Tidal Financial Group, and the YWCA highlights an innovative approach to aligning financial returns with social impact.

articles.title: Alphabet is the bargain stock among the ‘Magnificent Seven’
articles.summary: Alphabet, Google's holding company, is highlighted as a compelling investment opportunity among the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks due to its valuation. Its stock trades at a lower price/earnings valuation than the S&P 500, positioning it as a bargain compared to its peers and the broader market. This situation is likened to the opportunity presented by Meta's stock after its 2022 decline.

articles.title: Gaia Launches Gaia+, the World’s Most Extensive Streaming Platform for Transformation
articles.summary: Gaia, Inc. has launched Gaia+, an enhanced streaming platform offering over 8,000 documentaries and series focused on transformation, spiritual growth, and consciousness expansion. This new platform provides access to immersive workshops, live events, and guided programs led by expert teachers. Gaia+ aims to empower its community with resources for personal development, stress alleviation, and abundance manifestation, available across various mobile and connected TV devices.

articles.title: Get to know QQQ: Charting 25 years of performance
articles.summary: The article celebrates 25 years of the Invesco QQQ ETF, tracing its evolution from its launch in 1999 to becoming one of the largest ETFs today. It highlights key milestones such as reaching significant assets under management (AUM), changes in sponsorship and naming, and its consistent outperformance compared to the S&P 500. QQQ is presented as a proven way for investors to gain exposure to highly innovative, non-financial companies listed on the Nasdaq-100 Index.

articles.title: Seeking a Growth ETF with Strong Returns? Check Out ILCG
articles.summary: The iShares Morningstar Growth ETF (ILCG) is highlighted as a strong option for investors seeking growth, offering diversified exposure to 389 top U.S. large- and mid-cap growth stocks. The article emphasizes its long track record of strong returns, low expense ratio of 0.04%, and consistent double-digit annualized returns since its inception in 2004. Despite slightly underperforming the S&P 500 over three years, ILCG has outperformed it over five and ten-year periods, making it a reliable, cost-effective long-term investment.

articles.title: The U.S. sues Apple, saying it abuses its power to monopolize the smartphone market
articles.summary: The Justice Department, along with 15 states and D.C., has filed a major antitrust lawsuit against Apple, accusing the tech giant of abusing its monopoly power in the smartphone market. The lawsuit alleges that Apple restricts access to its hardware and software, designs features like iMessage and Apple Pay to lock users into its ecosystem, and suppresses competition, leading to fewer options and higher prices for consumers. Apple denies these claims, stating that its restrictions protect user privacy and security, and vows to vigorously defend itself against the suit.
